headline.main: Paid Notice: Deaths  BEINFIELD, WILLIAM H.

docs.snippet: BEINFIELD--William H.,M.D., died peacefully on March 28, 2014 at the age of 95. Beloved and devoted husband of 57 years to the late Nancy Irle. Cherished and loving father of Robert Beinfield and Linda Hoffman. Adored grandfather of Sam, Noah, Bre...
docs.lead_paragraph: BEINFIELD--William H.,M.D., died peacefully on March 28, 2014 at the age of 95. Beloved and devoted husband of 57 years to the late Nancy Irle. Cherished and loving father of Robert Beinfield and Linda Hoffman. Adored grandfather of Sam, Noah, Brett and Owen. Funeral services will be held on Wednesday, April 2nd at noon. Frank E. Campbell, 1076 Madison Ave. at 81st Street. In lieu of flowers, contributions may be made to Multiple Myeloma Research Foundation. www.themmrf.org

headline.main: Paid Notice: Deaths  CAMPBELL, WILLIAM REASON

docs.snippet: CAMPBELL--William Reason, 85, of Brewster, NY died Sunday, March 30, 2014. Born in Wauseon, OH, son of Leila (Rockwood) and Reasin (Solomon) Campbell. He was a graduate of Harvard University and the author of the memoir: "Dead Man Walking, Teachin...
docs.lead_paragraph: CAMPBELL--William Reason, 85, of Brewster, NY died Sunday, March 30, 2014. Born in Wauseon, OH, son of Leila (Rockwood) and Reasin (Solomon) Campbell. He was a graduate of Harvard University and the author of the memoir: "Dead Man Walking, Teaching in a Maximum Security Prison" He is survived by his daughter: Sarah, his son: Morgan, his grandson: Ryan and his niece: Cynthia Shaughnessy. The family will receive friends on Tuesday, April 1 from 6:00 to 9:00pm at Clark Associates Funeral Home, 4 Woods Bridge Road, Katonah, NY. The funeral service will be held 11am on Wednesday, April 2 also at the funeral home. Burial will follow at Ivandell Cemetery, Somers.

headline.main: Paid Notice: Deaths  GIBBONS, BARBARA HALLORAN

docs.snippet: GIBBONS--Barbara Halloran, Syndicated columnist ("The Slim Gourmet") Barbara Halloran Gibbons died March 26, 2014 in Dallas, TX. Born in Newark, NJ, she lived in New Jersey through the mid 1990s, and wrote the three times weekly low calorie cookin...
docs.lead_paragraph: GIBBONS--Barbara Halloran, Syndicated columnist ("The Slim Gourmet") Barbara Halloran Gibbons died March 26, 2014 in Dallas, TX. Born in Newark, NJ, she lived in New Jersey through the mid 1990s, and wrote the three times weekly low calorie cooking column featured in over 200 newspapers throughout the 1970s-'90s, as well as a similar monthly column in Family Circle magazine. The author of 16 cookbooks, including two Tastemaker Award winners, she was also a travel photographer and writer and a member of the Travel Journalists Guild. She was the wife of the late WI Gibbons and partner for 30 years to Gerald T. Gallagher, mother of Susan Gibbons Gillespie of New Jersey and grandmother to four: Daniel and Isaac Gillespie, both of New York, Christopher Gillespie of Washington, DC and Benjamin Gillespie, of Omaha, NE. Memorial Service at 3pm, April 6, at Trinity Covenant Church, 343 East Cedar St., Livingston, NJ.

headline.main: Paid Notice: Deaths  MORGAN, PRISCILLA MINER

docs.snippet: MORGAN--Priscilla Miner. Born in Poughkeepsie, New York on October 10th, 1919, Priscilla died peacefully at home in Manhattan on March 30th, 2014. Great aunt and great friend. She studied at Vassar College and served as a WAVES officer during WWII...
docs.lead_paragraph: MORGAN--Priscilla Miner. Born in Poughkeepsie, New York on October 10th, 1919, Priscilla died peacefully at home in Manhattan on March 30th, 2014. Great aunt and great friend. She studied at Vassar College and served as a WAVES officer during WWII. Priscilla began her ground-breaking career in show business as a producer of radio and early television. She became an agent, representing Julie Harris, Jerry Herman, Tad Mosel, Gian Carlo Menotti, Fred Coe and Arthur Penn at Liebling & Wood, the Priscilla Morgan Agency and the William Morris Agency. Priscilla then joined Menotti in Italy as associate director of the Spoleto Festival, which she brought to the United States. A founding board member of her friend Isamu Noguchi's Garden Museum in Long Island City, she devoted her last decades to furthering artistic causes and nurturing friendships across many generations. Memorial contributions, if desired, may be made to the Children's Aid Society. "To love with all one's soul and leave the rest to fate."

docs.snippet: Rosenman--Phyllis, died March 30, 2014 after 94 full years of life. She was a devoted wife, mother, grandmother, great-grandmother, sister, aunt and mother-in-law. She will be forever missed....
docs.lead_paragraph: Rosenman--Phyllis, died March 30, 2014 after 94 full years of life. She was a devoted wife, mother, grandmother, great-grandmother, sister, aunt and mother-in-law. She will be forever missed.

docs.snippet: MORGAN--Priscilla. The Trustees and staff of The Noguchi Museum join with the many who mourn the passing of the indefatigable and ever charming Priscilla Morgan, a founding member of the board and our first Honorary Life Trustee. A force of nature...
docs.lead_paragraph: MORGAN--Priscilla. The Trustees and staff of The Noguchi Museum join with the many who mourn the passing of the indefatigable and ever charming Priscilla Morgan, a founding member of the board and our first Honorary Life Trustee. A force of nature she stood loyally and steadfastly for all she believed in. Precise and high standards defined her and she brought these to the relationships and organizations she so dedicated herself to. Key amongst these was her love for Isamu Noguchi and by extension his Museum which she not only assisted in founding, but continually affirmed, and in her inimitable way helped lead. Her sparkle, her great stories, her mercurial ways and underlying warmth touched all who knew her. She will remain a guiding light to the Noguchi Museum as we move forward. We shall miss her inexplicably. David D. Holbrook, Chairman Jenny Dixon, Director

docs.snippet: MORGAN--Priscilla. Legendary and generous supporter of the arts leaves an enduring mark on the organizations and lives of so many individuals that she helped cultivate and enrich. She passionately and fastidiously honored the legacy of Isamu Noguc...
docs.lead_paragraph: MORGAN--Priscilla. Legendary and generous supporter of the arts leaves an enduring mark on the organizations and lives of so many individuals that she helped cultivate and enrich. She passionately and fastidiously honored the legacy of Isamu Noguchi (1904 1988) through the Isamu Noguchi Foundation and Garden Museum in New York, pioneering the transformation of Long Island City into an arts destination. After nearly 30 years, we will miss collaborating with Priscilla on the Noguchi Foundation and museum. We extend our most heartfelt condolences to all who knew her. Susan Dunne, Arne and Milly Glimcher and the entire staff of Pace Gallery

docs.snippet: MORGAN--Priscilla. Ghetto Film School mourns the death of our dear friend and supporter, Priscilla....
docs.lead_paragraph: MORGAN--Priscilla. Ghetto Film School mourns the death of our dear friend and supporter, Priscilla.
